definition: to step on/to tread/to stamp/to press a pedal/to pedal (a bike)/(online) to downvote
color/complexion/looks/variant of 彩[cai3]/variant of 採|采[cai3]
to tread water/to paddle or tramp in shallow water
see 腳踏兩隻船|脚踏两只船[jiao3 ta4 liang3 zhi1 chuan2]
crawl high, step low (idiom); unprincipled crawling, flattering one's superiors and trampling on one's juniors/toadying and bullying
to step on the brake/to brake (when driving)
to operate by means of a pedal
to scout for a tour operator/to reconnoiter a potential tour itinerary/(tennis) to commit a foot fault
group on a tour to get acquainted with the local situation

sentences.english: See, I stopped at the red traffic light, and I swear it never turned green!
sentences.chinese: 紅燈亮了，我踩了腳剎車，誰知道那燈再沒變綠過。

sentences.english: I twisted round and went to slam on the brakes, but in my confusion hit the accelerator a second time.
sentences.chinese: 我扭過身，猛地踩剎車，但是混亂中我又踩了油門。

sentences.english: I twisted round and went to slam on the brakes, but in my confusion hit the accelerator a second time.
sentences.chinese: 我扭過身，猛地踩剎車，但是混亂中我又踩了油門。

sentences.english: He's a real klutz and will probably step on your feet!
sentences.chinese: 他是個傻瓜，而且可能會踩你的腳的。

sentences.english: We can enjoy the sea breeze and the soft sand.
sentences.chinese: 我們能吹吹海風，還能踩在軟軟的沙子上。

sentences.english: You showed us the toe holds and finger holds.
sentences.chinese: 您指給我們踩腳點和抓手點。

sentences.english: Harris removes it and smashes it on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 哈里斯拿掉了這個裝置，並用腳踩碎在地上。

sentences.english: The snow on the pavement was compacted and has turned to ice.
sentences.chinese: 人行便道上的雪被踩實並結成了冰。

sentences.english: He steps up onto the chair. It wobbles queasily.
sentences.chinese: 他站到椅子上，椅子被踩地顫動起來。

sentences.english: Had taken a step big or it is easy to walk in footplate brim trip.
sentences.chinese: 邁步過大或踩在踏板邊緣容易摔倒等。

sentences.english: We hold the same hope, stepping a further and further road.
sentences.chinese: 我們擁有一樣的希望，把腳下的路越踩越長。

sentences.english: He winced as she stood on his injured foot .
sentences.chinese: 她踩着他受傷的腳，他疼得齜牙咧嘴。

sentences.english: He was told not to tread the earth round the roots of the seedling.
sentences.chinese: 他被吩咐不可把樹苗根部周圍的土踩硬。

sentences.english: Our feet crunched on the frozen snow.
sentences.chinese: 我們的雙腳嘎吱作響地“踩”着冰凍的雪地。

sentences.english: I dare you to skateboard to Krusty Burger and back.
sentences.chinese: 我說你不敢踩着滑板往返庫里斯蒂漢堡。

definition: to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot
to step on/to tread on/to wear (shoes)/(slang) to dump (sb)/Taiwan pr. [deng4]
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
(physics) inertia/(fig.) force of habit/tendency to do things in the accustomed way/habitual
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
to operate by means of a pedal
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
